REVIEW: Nov 8 2008 	Overpriced - even for NTC	Hotel expectations in NYC always need to be quite low. But I have just checked in at the Marcel with front desk staff who behave as though you are spending about a quarter of the actual cost of this place. And then a TINY TINY room with an air-conditioner from the 1970s, a few touches to make it look 'design' or 'boutique' but it doesn't hide the fact that it is not 100% clean, the bathroom suite is old fashioned and ugly and there is not even a wardrobe to store clothes. I would not stay again.

Nov 4 2008 	Clean convenient	This hotel is in a nice location, convenient to the subway and to midtown. It is very clean and the staff are friendly and helpful. The room was small but we expect that in NYC and it was not tiny.The shower had only half a door! That was weird. It had what looked like half a sliding door but it did not slide. I called the front desk, assuming it was broken, and was told it was meant to be that way. So when you showered some water always got on the floor. There was no place to put anything in the shower, no shelf for your shampoo or razor.There is a very nice area on the 10th floor where wifi is available. They serve a continental breakfast which we did not buy, but coffee was free. There is an outdoor area too, on the 10th floor, which looked like it would be great when the weather is right.Aside from the shower we were satisfied with the hotel. There are plenty of places to eat that are very close by

Nov 4 2008 	OK but not for 350$	We went there with my husbant between 23-29October 2008. After reading most of the reviews we requested for a front room overlooking the street rather than a back room. The size was very good and extremely comfortable, design was modern and room was very clean. The only problem with the room was - as one other reviewer mentioned- that the windows are not double glazed and imagine that the hotel is on 3rd avenue. The first 2 days we didn't have a problem as we were knackered from jetlag but after that the noise was too loud to have a decent amount of sleep so we ended up waking up every day at least at 7!!! On the noise issue, the first day we arrived we noticed that there was a connected door in our room which was locked and when you opened it it faced another door locked from inside from the adjoining room. First day the adjoining room was obviously NOT accupied. Second day, we had to wake up in the middle of the night because of laughter and conversation that I thought was taking place in our room - please bear in mind that in this hotel the acoustics are UNBELIEVABLE! You hear everything...even noises from toillet and showers.Also note that there was no room service until late afternoon, so no coffe in the morning if you want to have one in your room (not a big one for me but my husbant wanted an early morning waker so he had to dress and go to a Starbucks further down 3rd avenue).We have checked the 9th floor room with the complimentary coffee and pcs but bear in mind that this is the size of 2 small hotel rooms; pcs were almost always taken; view is truly very nice. Coffee not that great, even if it is complimentary...to be honest I have not tried the complimentary cheese in the afternoons.Staff specially the doormas was very nice - reception people were a bit indifferent, not too much bothered.Overall I would say that it was ok but not for this amount of money and they definitely need to do something about the noise...

Oct 23 2008 	Fantastic	I loved the Marcel! Although the rooms are rather small, the comfort is fantastic. Especially the bed is great (exactly what you need after long strolling trough the city). Anyway i thought the room would eventually warm up so i let it go. I then noticed the horrendouss noise from outside, after checking the window i found it was broken. I asked for another room and was moved to a room that was so small the door hit the mini bar when i tried to open it. Oct 8 2008 	We'll be back! Aug 3 2008 	Great service.	Stayed here 5 nights. Good lower midtown location. Jul 6 2008 	Great hotel with friendly staff and god location	The Marcel is a good looking, small hotel with a good location close to Union Square etc. We stayed in a superior room that was nicely decorated and featured a view of the Empire State. Jun 27 2008 	great moderately priced hotel	We recently stayed at the Marcel Hotel for 1 week from 7-14 June. What a find!. We did a lot of searching on the internet to get just the right hotel for us and finally decided to take a gamble with The Marcel. We were apprehensive at first as, with all hotels on Trip Advisor, there are always negative reviews as well as positive. We were thrilled with our choice. The location is great - in Murray Hill in midtown Manhattan, a relatively quiet area for NY (hotel is on the corner of 3rd Avenue and E 24th St). We had booked a deluxe room and based on other travellers' comments we had asked for a corner room which we got on the 7th floor (the hotel is only 10 floors). It was ample big enough for us and had 2 large windows looking out to the Empire State Building which was nearby. The bathroom was fine and cleanliness was excellent. Check in staff were friendly as were the doormen. We did not notice any traffic noise from the 7th floor. However, the next door room had their music blaring loudly until 1am but the staff dealt with that once we complained. There is an attractive lounge on the 10th floor (with great views of the ESB) with free internet access and a great coffee machine (available from 11am) where we had the best cafe au laits in NY! The lounge led to a rooftop deck which had just been developed with attractive shrubs in planters and loungers to relax on after a hard day's trudging around NY sights. 3rd Avenue has great restaurants and we particularly enjoyed Bamiyan (Afghani) and the Vertigo Bar. Pick A Bagel a block away satisfied out breakfast pangs.What a great moderately priced hotel and what a great city. Can't wait to go back.

Jun 18 2008 	Average room excellent price sketchy website	I stayed at the Hotel Marcel in April 2008. This is a modern styled hotel in the Rose Hill neighborhood. The hotel room was overall adequate - it was bigger than I expected, but it had a slight air of residual smoke even though it was a non-smoking room. It wasn't bad enough for me to complain though, so I don't have any feedback on how the hotel would have dealt with this issue. The TV channel selection was pretty bad - many of the channels did not work. The bed was comfortable, but the street noise was a little bothersome. This is a problem with many hotels in Manhattan and it wasn't any worse than average NYC hotels. I did have an issue with booking my hotel - I booked through the hotel's web site (nychotels.com). While this clearly got me the best rate (less than $300 a night in Manhattan), the e-mail confirmation I got almost made me believe the web site was a fake. It looked very unofficial, and had my credit card number and expiration date in clear text. This is unacceptable in the modern internet era, in my opinion. I also only received a booking number, not a confirmation number. When I called to confirm my reservation, they could not find it at first (but they eventually did). I would recommend calling the hotel to confirm any reservation.Overall, the incredible price I was able to get for this room outweighed the minor flaws of the hotel. None of the items I've mentioned above had a negative impact on my stay, which is what I demand from a hotel.

May 4 2008	pleasant hotel	lovely hotel, good location, bit expensive, but that's manhattan, friendly staff and very helpfull, love to stay there again next time!!!!!

Apr 1 2008 	Overrated mediocre hotel	I just spent 7 nights at the Marcel so I have a pretty good sense of this hotel. They try to project a fancier image with doormen, funky decor and wine and cheese in the evening, but it didn't really live up to my expectations. My room--one bed-- was very, very tiny. I know it's New York, but when there's no place to put your suitcase, it's rough. The room decor is clashing but fun. I enjoyed the modern colors and prints. I had to pay extra for the wireless service, which isn't cheap, and while it was adequate, it was rather slow. One plus was the front desk staff and doormen. They were always friendly and helpful. I think if this hotel works on improving their cleaning staff, it can get better, but you might want to ask if they have larger rooms.

Jan 2 2008 	Would stay again in a heartbeat!	Stayed there for 4 nights after Christmas and was most impressed with the Marcel. On check in, we were greeted with a glass of champagne, and then when we asked if it was possible to get a room with a view, the check in staff gave us an awesome room, with a direct view of the Empire State Building.The room was more than big enough for the two of us with a great dual shower! Dec 27 2007 	Renovations Worth Waiting For!	We stayed one night the weekend before Christmas to see the Seurat exhibit at the MOMA. We had stayed about nine months before in early summer. At that time the hotel was completing a much needed renovation. We were not lucky enough to get a renovated room that time and the room showed its wear. I remember feeling quite disappointed that the room was much more drab and worn than the display photos showed. This visit the renovations were finished and the hotel was transformed. The lobby and reception area are tasteful, comfortable, and (particularly welcome in December) features a sitting area with a gas fireplace. The person at the reception desk was friendly, helpful, and happy to explain to us that while the hotel no longer offered free espresso in the lobby, they did offer free coffee in the tenth floor lounge. Our room, this time, was on the tenth floor. The hotel now has two elevators, one larger and one very small. I only remember one at our last stay. On the tenth floor were several rooms and the lounge. This area had the promised free coffee, a large flat screen TV and two computer stations offering free internet access (one was not operational). When we entered our room we were shocked. It featured a sitting area with two white leather arm chairs, a white leather lounger seat with a footstool, a snack bar and stocked refrigerator, and a flat screen TV. The carpet was new, clean, and with a simple narrow black and white stripe. Pushing our way through a set of double frosted glass doors we found a room with a king sized bed, another flat screen TV and a closet. Peeking into the bathroom we saw new modern fixtures, a hand-held shower, and the deepest bath (with jets!) I'd ever seen in a hotel. Nervously we called down to the front desk to make sure of our rate (a fantastic rate, prepaid though Expedia) and to make sure there'd been no mistake. The person apologized for frightening us and said that he gave us a free upgrade to the best room available, he thought we'd like it. Well, we did. I know that we were in an atypical room, more deluxe than one we would usually stay in, but the entire hotel was clean, tastefully decorated in a simple black and white theme, and staffed with friendly, helpful people. There were only a couple of issues that could be improved. There was an issue with the cable TV in our room and while we had many of the channels we could not get the pay-per-view to work. That was a disappointment. One of the computers in the tenth floor lounge was not operational and it would have been helpful if there was a sign on it that informed of this fact. Our room and bathroom was spotlessly cleaned, but when I filled the tub and used the jets it became obvious that they had sat unused for quite a while because they shot out some black flecks that looked like mold had developed in the jets. No big deal, and fixable by filling the tub and operating the jets on a more regular basis. So, a clean, safe, well staffed hotel in a safe neighborhood two blocks from the subway with some very minor maintenance issues. We'll be back!There is a 24 hour diner a block away and a coffee shop just across the street from that. There is also your typical small NY market that sells just about everything; we were able to buy the toothpaste we'd forgotten to pack and the bottled sparkling water we prefer to drink.

Dec 22 2007 	Few problems but nice stay	After reading the reviews, i was having second thoughts but i'm glad i stayed. the boyfriend and i were originally booked for the standard room, but upgraded to deluxe when noticing the price for deluxe was only $10 the night before. Cons:-the toilet didn't flush, but the boyfriend fooled around and fixed it within 3 min, so nothing big.-they didn't have their pay per view or On demand setup.-TV was a little blurry-mini bar was overly priced-the last morning we were there, we heard some random loud drilling and hammering around 7 or 8 am, not good. Dec 3 2007 	Extremely 	After reading the reviews of the Marcel here on trip advisor i was prepared for disappointment. I had wanted to stay at 60 Thompson or The Chambers (both 4/5 star boutique hotels where i've had pleasant stays previously, and both double the price of the Marcel), but they were totally booked out - as were all the other options i would have taken over this particular hotel.On arrival my concerns were not exactly alleviated when i was told by reception that there was no hot water AND no telephone / internet service: both facilites were being 'upgraded' and would not be available until the following day.Not a good start.However, i had made the effort of contacting the hotel directly two weeks before travelling and secured a corner room on a high floor. This truned out to be a VERY good move because the room was utterly wonderful: it was large (larger than rooms at either 60 Thompson or The Chambers), furnished in a very hip yet very sophisticated style, and everything from the carpet to the bed to the leather desk to the flat screen tv to the i-pod dock clock-radio appeared to be brand, spanking new.I had two huge, beautiful windows and a double aspect view. Even the bathroom was a pleasant surprise - much better than expected after looking at the 'reviewers' photos on this website. If you ever stay at this hotel - definitely try and secure a corner room (there's only one per floor).There was a fully stocked mini-bar (but interestingly without any alcohol) and the extra ameneties were as good, if not better, than any boutique hotel.The following morning the hot water was back on and the telephone was working fine, with no more problems for the duration of my 4 night stay.There were two great, traditional diners just two blocks from the hotel, and a great bar / restaurant called VERTIGO serving some truly excellent contemporary American food (and - amazingly - English cider!).The bottom line? There really is no need to spend double the money. Excellent stay - i'd definitely go back, but they'd have to guarantee me that corner room!

Dec 3 2007 	Nice for the right price...	After reading the reviews here on Trip Advisor, I approached the Marcel with some caution. It turned out okay, no major complaints, but not exactly the best value either.Some caveats: this was supposed to be a romantic getaway weekend for the wife and & I, and we looked pretty casually for a place until about a month before. As it turned out, the first weekend in Nov. is Marathon weekend in NYC. No wonder all the rooms disappeared seemingly overnight. What we were left with was little choice, and much higher rates than expected.The review: The Marcel is a standard european style boutique hotel with a modern decor. You see these places popping up all over the last few years. Most recently we stayed at the Roger Williams (back in '03) for dirt cheap ($140/nt), but now it's almost $500 a night.The rooms in the Marcel (we saw 2) are small - 9' x 12' or so. The beds are nicely sized, but take up a lot of room. Add up the small dressers, mini fridge, and night tables and it becomes pretty tight. This was not a surprise, as most hotels like this are similarly laid out.The bed was comfy, and linens were soft and fresh. No laundry or bleach smells. The Bathroom was really tight, but ample. The shower was a walk-in style, which I'll save for the "Cons" part of the review.The Closet was small, but adequate, the "dressers" consisted of a 2 whole drawers and a space below. The night tables each had a drawer, but we just put our extra clothes in a pile on the floor next to the bed.We had room 910, which had a huge window overlooking 24th st. This provided a respite from what would have otherwise been a claustrophobic experience. Plenty of light and air (thru open windows). Not an inspiring view, but nice to have one just the same. Close the blinds at night, unless you don't mind being on display for the apartment building across the street - they sure don't....Based on reviews here, I originally asked for a room away from the stairs. We were given 501, I believe. It had a view of the interior of the building - essentially a black brick wall. The room was a scosh bigger, but the wife said no way. So they moved us up to 910. No stair issues to contend with, however it was right next to the elevators. This proved to be a non-issue, even on a weekend. Very little noise there, or from outside, for that matter. Unless you're visiting from rural Montana, I think you'd find it surprisingly quiet.The Bad:Walk-in shower. Why do hotels insist on this? the curtains leave a 2 inch gap and spray soaks the whole floor. Ask for an extra towel.Mini-bar. I'm going to agree with the reviewer who said to leave space for my stuff too. Not only is the contents ridiculously overpriced, but there's a tray on top stocked with goodies that sit on little sensors. If an item is removed for more than 20 seconds it gets charged to your account automatically (WTF?!!). Insideous, no? We moved the tray out of the way and used it for our own crap.Outlets. These days, most travelers come packed like a gadget store: cell phone, digital camera, video camera, iPod, laptop, etc. and all these things come with charger. Knowing this, why are the outlets tucked away under the night tables (that don't move), virtually unreachable, and filled with lamp and clock plugs? Sure, there's one by the TV, but it's 3 feet of the floor, better hope your little charger doesn't fall out. Would a courtesy outlet be so wrong?....In a nutshell:Nice decor, Nice neighborhood - (Pick-a-Bagel 2 blocks south was awesome) quiet, plenty of amenities nearby, #6 train 2 blocks east.Friendly staff, willing to accomodate if asked. Clean, small rooms. Inconvenient outlets, and a somewhat messy shower.Would I stay again? if the price dropped $200, yes.Take a look at my review for the WalkNYC (.com) private walking tour we did. Highly Recommended.

Aug 19 2007 	Be sure to check what your getting!	I stayed at The Hotel Marcel twice in August 2007, once from the 6th-11th and again from the 17-18th, with my mother.I am aware the place is being renovated, and it was looking much better at the time of my second stay, however I believe that some features should have been sorted out before the hotel opened.My initial impression of the Hotel wasn't great, the outside looked rather tacky with brown covers in the brown windows giving the impression that the place had closed down. Inside however it was modern and very tastefully decorated, albeit a little too cold due to excessive use of air conditioning. At the time of my first stay only one lift was working, this was very slow, with wallpaper peeling off the walls and wires hanging out it would not have been very safe for a small child. The room (one with two beds) though like the Hotel lobby, tastefully decorated, was rather small, once suitcases had been placed on the floor (two) there was little space on the ground to move. The big flat screen TV looked rather out of place on a room of this size. Fortunatley it was not too hot and stuffy in the room, as the air conditioning unit was rather noisy, causing problems particularly at night. The walls were very thin and traffic could be heard the whole night and on the last three nights when the road outside was dug up from about 6am we could hear the drill being used. The bathroom however was clean & tidy with amenities such as soap, shampoo, conditioner and a rather useless shower cap provided (I suggest you bring your own). The shower was a fixed one located in the bath and if you wanted a hot shower you could not control the ammount of water coming out, meaning that water would go everywhere.The Hotel is not in that central a location, it takes about 30-40 mins on a bus or subway train to get to Times Square and there is no restaurant as it is currently being renovated (despite claims on many websites that it is open).On the 2nd stay despite requesting a 2 bed room my mother & I ended up in a one bed room which was so cramped and dark, (the window was round the corner and did not let any natural light into the room) that despite the fact we were only staying one night we asked to move. Luckily they did have a two bed room free which was much bigger and lighter.By this time the 2nd lift was working and the 1st one had been renovated, though the restaurant was still closed.If you end up staying at this hotel, even if you'll be on your own do request a two bed room and check that is what you'll be getting.

Jan 7 2007 	worth a try	I must admit to nearly cancelling my stay after reading the reviews but went through with it with a little trepidation. I had stayed at the hotel previously and whilst the hotel has certainly gone down a little in recent years it is still a good bet.It is true that construction work is ongoing, as some rooms are being refurbished. You might be unfortunate enough to be next to one of these rooms and thenI imagine it would be quite disruptive during the day. We only experienced it through the occasional worker in the lift which was an inconvenience but manageable.The rooms are indeed very small, but from my experience that seems to be the norm in New York. Our room had no view and little natural light from the small window to the rear. Other rooms we saw seemed to be slightly larger and had larger windows onto the street. Our bathroom door did not close and the tv control did not work but these were both put right immediately by the hotel, whose staff were helpful throughout our stay.Things in the hotel's favour are its price which is pretty reasonable if you can get one of the deals available through expedia, or similar. Its location, whilst not notable in itself has many great neighbourhood bars and shops. The Bull's Head nearby is a cool young bar with lively band nights. Molly's is a fantastic classy irish bar and a good place to spend a few hours at the bar, in good hands.There are a number of great diners,in the area for huge tasty breakfasts, the Lyric and Cosmos are particularly good, and the hotel supplies free coffee through a machine in the lobby.The hotel is within good walking range of Chelsea and the East Village and close to the subway, a few blocks along 23rd St.The room was very clean and the bed very comfortable. The bathroom, again tiny, was spotless and had a full-size bath and was supplied with clean towels daily and all the necessary soaps, lotions etc.All in all I would recommend the hotel, albeit with some reservations. If you plan to spend a lot of time in your room I would recommend elsewhere, but then you probably shouldn't be in New York anway if that was the case.I would go back again but would be happier to do so after the current 'improvements' have been made.

Dec 1 2006	A mixed bag mediocre overall	I took a chance on the Marcel when Priceline could not get me a 3 star hotel for $250.00 in late November. I paid $227.00 plus tax at the Marcel. I was hoping that the reviews on TripAdvisor would prove to be overly negative. Unfortunately, most of the negative comments proved to be true. The hotel was under construction, with workers in the lobby and riding the shabby elevator all day. They seem to be working on the upper levels of the building, and there were no hassles from construction on the 4th floor, where I stayed. Reception was friendly and they allowed me to check in early (around noon). A nice doorman came right out to help me with luggage. The worst part of the hotel for me, was the hallway outside the room. It looked like what I would expect in a flophouse--dimly lit, peeling paint, doors leading to spooky vacant rooms. My hotel room was ok. The decor reminded me of something you would see on Trading Spaces--cute modern design, done on the cheap. The striped Roman window shade was already broken. There was no desk in the room, but there was a TV, drawers for clothes, bedside lighting, wireless internet ($9.95 per day extra), and ironing board. The bathroom was fine, with green marble tile and respectable toiletries. The best part of the room was the bed, which was just like the pictures on the internet. There was, as others have noted, a lot of noise from 3rd avenue. I didn't find that a problem for sleeping, since it was mainly just cars driving along, and I could pretend I was hearing the ocean (ok, call me Pollyanna).I didn't bother with the coffee machine in the lobby, since there was a Starbucks nearby. Plenty of nice restaurants around the corner, too.I wish I had gotten a slightly better price (under $200) and then I could have overlooked the demerits more easily. I won't stay there again--it would have been worth $50 or so more for a "normal" hotel.

Jul 9 2006	Splendid	The Marcel is a wonderful little boutique hotel, perfect if you hate the monstrocsties with 9000 rooms. The staff couldn't be lovelier. They were friendly and very accommodating. May 1 2006 	Marcel reacts unbelievably well	I stayed at the Marcel the same night the entire hotel was evacuated due to weather related issues. The Marcel hotel took it upon their duty to relocate us to another wondeful hotel FREE OF CHARGE. I felt that the staff handled the situation unbelievably well, along with assisting the young infants and the elderly guest out safe and unharmed. I asked the hotel employees how they stayed so calm during such tense moments and the clerk responded, "as a hotel in NYC we are prepared for any situation at any given moment, we have contingency plans for almost any event or situation that comes along." The bellman was driving the young infants and elderly to other hotels in the area, and thankfully the front desk was able to relocate me to there other lovely hotel "The Bentley". Unfortunately this happened at 2 am, and if the Marcel reacted to the incident in any other way less than they did I would say that I wouldn't reccomend it. However, the Marcel reacted extremely well and I would recommend this hotel, knowing that when I go to sleep the gentleman downstairs are watching over us, and the safety of others.

All smokers' romms are situated on the second floor. we were first given a room on the 2nd floor with no view at all and it was very dirty and stinkling with smoke smell. i asked for a change, so I got a room after two days delay that had a street view. it was still a smokers' romm, was more noisy but had windows to "breathe" a little. the rooms were all relatively small. Still, it's a good hotel, conveniently located between downtown and midtown if you like Soho and Nolita but also want to do some shopping in midtown retailers.If you can afford more, go to another hotel.

Sep 26 2005	Clean in a good area and no late-check out fee until 2 PM!	The Marcel is great, especially for those travelling on a budget and making last minute plans. I booked the room Thursday night for Friday night (usually a pricey way to go about seeing NYC) and the room was only $237 with tax thru Nychotels. Granted, $237 isn't cheap, but it was in a great location (everywhere in Manhattan is very accessible and the area seemed very safe). Rooms aren't anything special... if you're expecting The Plaza, that is. I was happy simply because the tub was clean, and the bed was super comfortable and big enough so that my boyfriend wouldn't get upset when I hogged all the sheets (added bonus: bed comes with four fantastic pillows, no having to call the front desk and call for extra). What else do you need when you've got NYC to explore?

Sep 23 2005	the worst hotel ever	We recently stayed 4 nites at the Marcel Hotel during fashion week. The price was outrageously overpriced; 400/nite. The first room faced the street and was extremely loud. Although the room was a nice size, there was no phone, no room service, no mini bar, only two towels and the remote didn't work for the TV. The air conditioner would wail like a banshee every half hour. We asked to move and got a smaller, but quieter room on the other side of the building. We got in to bed at around midnight and noticed that it was hotter than when we got in to the room. Sure enough, the air conditioner was broken. A guy came to take a look at it and said that it would not be repaired until tomorrow. We once again had to pack up our stuff and move. It was 1pm when we got in to our 3rd room, which was the size of a shoe box. We tripped over each other and finally stumbled in to bed. All nite we could hear the ding of the elevator and the doors opening and closing. Save yourself some misery and never, ever stay here. I called to talk to the manager and he is avoiding me like the plague. These people do not care. Obviously they don't need the business...

Sep 10 2005	Clean and great location- perfect for the traveller on a budget	For those travelling on a budget, I would definitely recommend the Marcel. My boyfriend and I paid $130 per night (inc. tax)- this is a fantastic rate for Manhattan. I've paid the same in other major cities (mainly London) for filthy, decrepit "hotels" where I literally feared for my safety. Our room was comfortable with a very clean en-suite bathroom. Yes, it was extremely small and our window directly faced a brick wall- but hey, are you really going to spend your time in a city like NYC holed up in your hotel? We also found the service completely adequate- we arrived well before official check in time and were taken straight to our room, and had no problems leaving our baggage at the desk after check-out, until we left NY that evening. For those unfamiliar with the city, let me stress that this is a great location ( I used to work in the area). It's a pleasant, relatively quiet neighbourhood, far from the tourist-trap nightmare that is Times Square and mid-town in general. Wonderful Grammercy Park is nearby, and Union Square and the East Village (loads of restaurants, bars, shops, etc). are within close range; plus, the 23rd Street "6" train stop is only a few blocks away and can take you to the tourist haunts, if you wish. There are some great eateries right there- let me recommend the Sunshine Diner right on third avenue for a quick bite (huge menu and portions), and Capucines on second avenue at 19th street for a classic NYC-Italian meal.If youre on a budget and simply looking to take in NYC from a clean and convenient base, the Marcel is completely acceptable. Those more concerned with amenities such as breakfast, car parking, views, and atmosphere should look elsewhere- and expect to pay for it.

Sep 5 2005	Very Small	My boyfriend and I stayed at the Marcel on Sept 4. The room was very small, I'd say 10x9. As we opened the door, the bed was right there. It was clean and quiet. If the rooms were bigger, it would be a nice hotel.

Sep 4 2005	Small but Nice	We stayed at the Marcel's for 3 nights. The rooms are very small but the beds are incredibly comfortable.The staff were very nice and helpful. The hotel is close to the subways so getting around Manhatten was quite easy. The bathrooms are stocked full of nice toiletries and you can get free coffee and capucino in the lobby. I'd recommend using the stairs when getting around the hotel. The elevator is slow and has a funky smell. Ice was always available. I would stay at the Marcel's again but only if we were 2 people sharing the room. We had my husband's teenage daughter with us so it got real crowded.

Aug 4 2005 	4 Stars?? I think not	Wasn't the WORST place you could stay in NYC, but no where near the best either. This hotel is also listed as a 4 star on many travel sites, but I can't understand why? This makes me wonder about the rating system in general. The rooms are small (not the smallest you'll get in NYC, but small). Lighting is really bad, gives the room a dark, closed in feeling. The room was fairly clean, although the bathroom could have been cleaner. I just expected more from this hotel, but should have known better.I was also worried about the posts of not having a reservation once I got there. I did go check in early (12pm), and didn't have a problem thankfully.If you want a hotel that's about the same price, stay at the Hudson. The Hudson has smaller rooms, but the decor is much better, along with the atmosphere.

Aug 2 2005	Marcel More So!	We were two Chicago girls in the Big Apple for a comedy festival but we were daunted by the reviews wed read below! The price was right ($127-$157 via their reservation line), but would the Marcel really turn out to be a dump? It was fine! There were a couple of glitches, but [insert Yiddish grandma voice here] for such a price, who could complain?The dcor might best be described as Ikea Wannabe: its a budget hotel, but at least they try for a boutique-hotel look. Our room (501) was tiny, better for a single traveler, but we did catch a peek at some larger rooms, which you might be able to request. No desk, no view other than a pigeon-stained sill and no soap dish in the bathtub. Just one grandfatherly elevator and crackly phone reception.But it was clean, quiet, came with a couple of toiletries, delicious push-button cappuccino in the lobby (but not in the mornings), the CD player in the alarm clock played our mix CD, and the mattress and pillows were firm. The comforter comes with a duvet cover, which keeps you from getting creeped out by Other Peoples Bedding, and when the front desk staff wasnt indifferent (no help finding a nail salon), they were gracious (thanks for the wine key). Best of all, the window shade really kept out the daylight so we could sleep off our nights out on the town!

Jun 14 2005	Disgusting	I made a booking through a reputable hotel discount site for 7 nights for two members of my family. Jun 9 2005	Don't even THINK about staying here	How ANYONE could review this with 5 stars I don't know. I booked through Hotels so I was absolutely screwed. By the way, my rate on hotelcom, was $280 or so.So, take my advice, do evemn THINK about staying at this place, even if it was for FREE. I'm 57 years old and a businessman. I've NEVER had an experience like this.

Jun 1 2005	Yet again no room	I too booked the Marcel in April of this year and paid up front with Expedia. I knew I would be ariving late so I faxed the hotel and took the confirmation slip with me. Ariving at the hotel about midnight we were told there were no rooms available but they would arange for us to stay in a hotel round the corner. This was the most awful place you could ever imagine to stay in, the type of hotel where you sleep on all your valuables and the ceiling tiles, it would seem were optional. 5 seconds was all that was needed to realise that we stood a better chance on the streets of NY with our suitcases than in that place. To cut a long story short we found another hotel which the Marcel did reimburse us for no problems but after a long flight do you really want to chance this hapening to you, I think not, there are plenty more to choose from.

May 18 2005	Good hotel for the price	This is a good hotel for the money. We managed to get the hotel for 70 a night and for that price in New York it was superb. The location is perfect. The shops and bars of Greenwich and the East Village are an easy walk away (14 blocks) as is the Empire State building. The rooms are tiny but contain everything you need including cable tv and a cd player. Don't let the size of the rooms put you off though, they look great. The bathroom was small but clean and nicely designed. The bed linen was perfect and changed daily. The staff were very helpful and polite and the limo service to the airport for our departure was good value for money ($10 more than a taxi) and convenient. The hotel looks as good as it does in the pictures on the internet. If I had to fault the hotel it would be the size of the rooms, our room really was very small but if you're reading this review the chances are you're looking for value for money which the Marcel certainly is. We'll definitely stay there again.

May 2 2005 	Would have loved a hot shower...	We needed this hotel to be near a medical conference at NYU. In that way it was great, just a few blocks up the street. Lots of nice shops, delis, etc in the area. The bed was delicious, reminded me of European hotel beds with the big down quilt. Nice to have a safe in the room, too.BUT - we arrived Friday afternoon and the first hot water was Sunday morning. Staff grudgingly said the repairman was on the way and we might have believed them except for the guy checking out who had been there for three days beforehand and had NO HOT WATER.You can't get ice, you have to ask for it. Just what I wanted - tipping for ice in a budget hotel.Bathroom's bizarre, and we nearly fell every time we walked out of the bathroom because the floor tilted so badly.Also, when the advert said "parking," we weren't ready to pay nearly $70 for the lot across the street. That's from Fri. nite to Sun. morning. And an extra charge for having an Envoy. sigh. At least the car was safe. I will look for another hotel next time, even if it means being farther away.

Apr 21 2005	very nice and worth every penny	we booked the hotel and flights with onlinetravel and found this hotel to be in a great location to access midtown (empire state etc) and down town (ground zero, wall street). The hotel lobby was modern with some good deco and to boast they supplied you with an unlimited supply of 24 hr FREE coffee!!! ( thats why the city never sleeps). I think myself and my brother almost drank them dry! The room was clean and cleaned each day, clean towels daily, and hoovered daily as i always got crumbs on the floor from my subway or deli sandwich!! We stopped on the fourth floor viewing third avenue noisy but thats part of new york which added to the charm. The staff were all very friendly holding the door for you every time you left or entered the building. At one point, my key card was not opening the door and all i had to do was go to reception and they sorted it straight away without any hassle. The city itself was amazing and once again worth every penny. There are forty nine dollar two day tours that you can hop on and off at any time or you can stay on the full circle which roughly takes two hours. Empire state costs 13 dollars to go to the top but you can pay an extra six to get an audio tour aswell which i would suggest to anyone. something that i only found out just before i was leaving and did not have time to do is that they do a free ferry to Staten island and back at the docks near battery park. The ferry to liberty island and ellis island costs 10 dollars but unfortunately you can no longer go to the top since 9/11.just want to say hi to heather who i left at home who i missed lots on my trip (arr)

Apr 17 2005	It was fine!	I was worried about this hotel after reading some of the reviews. The Marcell was fine. It was clean, functional and everything was as advertised. However the rooms were much smaller than we expected from the photos as was the foyer. The hotel was an excellent base for exploring this amazing city and the staff were curtious and helpful.Our tips - use the stairs..............waiting for the lift wastes shopping time and eat at Andreas (just round the corner, 307 3rd Ave at 23 St) it was lovely.

Apr 15 2005	terrible business	My husband and I booked a room through Expedia, called twice to confirm our reservation and reiterate we would have a late check-in. We arrive at the hotel at 2 in the morning, they had no room for us. We had already paid in full through Expedia. In 2004 a friend booked a room there and had EXACTLY the same thing happen. Don't book a room at this hotel!!!

Apr 14 2005 	Prepaid Reservation Yet Room Given Away Apathetic Staff	On the morning of my scheduled arrival, 4/9/05, at the Marcel Hotel in NY, I called the hotel and was able to confirm my reservation with them for 3 nights, which I had made through expedia. When I arrived at the hotel to check in just a few hours later, I was told by a woman named Albina FD, behind the front desk, that they were "having some problems with the rooms upstairs." I was then told that I would be moved to another hotel approximately 30 blocks away from this hotel. I spoke with both the manager and Albina. I expressed my overall disbelief at such an unacceptable situation. I told them that the reservation was pre-paid, asked them again how a hotel room could disappear within the span of a few hours, and then demanded that I receive all of my money back. They assured me that I would receive a full refund. This refund has not yet appeared on my credit card statement and I am becoming anxious about time lapsing as there is still an absence of this refund on my statement. So, not only was I robbed of accommodations, having to find another place to stay downtown within the span of an hour, but I am now being inconvenienced by also having to follow up on the refund to my credit card, something I would expect to occur as the most fundamental form of customer service from any reputable company. This ultimately disrupted an invaluable meeting of my own, both with a family member, and then later, a business partner. I am already dismayed at having to go to such great lengths to get money back for a service that I never received. So far, I have been robbed of over $600.00, by either Expedia or the Marcel Hotel. I don't know who is ultimately responsible at this point, but as Expedia's name is on my credit card as the payee, I shall first pursue this refund through Expedia.I am numbed by the apathy by both parties involved thus far, and by the underhanded way in which these companies have conducted business.

Apr 1 2005 	Loved it	This hotel is really great, an excellent value and good clean room. Staff was very accomodating to my needs and listened to every request I had. Enjoyed my sleep there in a very comfortable bed.

Mar 22 2005	Some don't like it hot	First impressions were good with a neatly dressed door guy, pleasant reception staff, and a tidy lobby.The room was boiling hot with constant heat that couldn't be adjusted. On complaining to the front desk we were told it was due to health and safety issues and that the hotel had to be kept to a certain temperature. I thought that was a neat twist on ' it's broken' The only way to cool it down was to open the window which due to traffic noise had to be shut at night.The bed was very comfy, the one chair was stained. The TV was in a wooden cupboard and angled so you had to sit on the right side of the bed or else you couldn't see the screen. There was no light switch for the main light by the bed, it had to be turned off at the doorThe bathroom was adequate, but lacked space to put your toiletries, the only shelf had the usual hotel freebies on it.There was only one lift for the 8 floors and you shared it with the hotel staff.A plus point was the very drinkable coffee available 24 hours a day in the lounge.From the reviews posted, the rooms in this hotel are not of a consistent standard and I would not recommend it.

Mar 21 2005	Very Happy	I loved this place,i have just recently stayed at this place in New York City for 6 nights and before arriving to the hotel was not really sure what to expect when thinking of some reviews read on the tripadviser,upon arriving,first thing i noticed it seemed to be a quite place which it really was,the staff was very helpful,always responded on time if any requests,and made arrangements for transportation to the airport,arrangements to visit statue of liberty,restaurant reservation and almost everything.I would again like to thank the young lady in the morning and the young man in the afternoon who tirelessly worked hard for their guests.I felt bad the other day when i saw a man yelling at the young lady regarding his reservation his 3-rd party agency messed.Anyway,i did enjoy the stay,very quite place,small cozy rooms.Will definitely be back.TIP:From now on i am going to ignore some reviews because most of these bad ones from people who expect TRUMP International for $30 a night.

Mar 19 2005	Disappointed	I guess you don't expect much for $200 in NYC but even at that the Marcel was a disappointment. The room was tiny and cave-like and the heat / AC had one setting: "blast furnace". To be comfortable we had to leave a window open but that meant the risk of allowing ledge roosting pigeons to enter. Worse was the front desk service. We got the run around on making shuttle arrangements and wound up having to take a car service to Newark Airport.

Mar 7 2005	Avoid this hotel	What do you get for $200 in New York City? Not much, judging from my recent stay at the Marcel Hotel where I calculated it cost me $50 for each hour of sleep I managed to get. The room was very small, very dark and ugly beyond belief in shades of prison grey-green and carpeted in German-style Art Deco brown in various patterns which make it look as it has been pieced together from off-cuts. The hotel is very noisy - every time anyone opens or shuts a door it reverberates through the corridor making sleep impossible. I was also disturbed by guests in the room opposite to mine having a noisy party with the door open and later woken by someone shouting obscenities and threats in the corridor. The front desk did solve this problem when I called down to tell them about it. There are no comforts at all, the TV is tiny, the bathroom cramped with thin towels and cheap shampoo, no coffee, no water, no room service, no fitness facilities. The room is clean and the check-in staff efficient.

Jan 23 2005	This hotel is perfectly fine	My husband and I stayed here for a week in mid January and I really found it fine. Our first room was near the emergency stairs and was a little loud as I am a very light sleeper, I mentioned this to the man who checked us in and he moved us with no problems to a different room towards the back of the hotel. The view wasn't great back there, but the room was clean, the shower FANTASTIC and the bed very comfy.It's pretty well placed for me as I don't spend all my time up in midtown, it's within walking distance of the East Village, Union Square and the Empire State Building. There's good bars on the nearest Avenue, a comedy club on the same road and the Lyric diner is a great close by place for breakfast if you're a little low on funds.This hotel is not a four or five star hotel, it is ??????60 a night in Manhatten job, it's not going to be perfect, but i found the staff helpfull and friendly and all the things I need, local info, cab booking, late check in, luggage holding, laundry service ect ect, were all present and correct.Also, when we left they called us a car service cab, a nice big Lincon, which cost $50 to JFK including tolls, and if you've ever had to get a yellow cab out there you'll know how usefull that is.Oh, and there is no way this hotel is dirty, it simply isn't, that's not up for discussion.

Jan 18 2005	Never never book this	Booked a room over the internet. Called day of travel to confirm the room and request late checkin and was told that all was fine. When we arrived late at night our room had been given away. Furthermore, the hotel lobby looked terrible compared with the photos. I hate to imagine what the rooms were like. It was dirty the man behind the desk was rude. I would only suggest you book this place for your worst enemy

Jan 13 2005	Not bad	We satayed here over the xmas weekend 2004Unlike other reviews we did not have great problems. the hotel is a budget hotel - perhaps not a 3 star but not bad. When we arrived we got stuck in the lift. After having problems at the airport with the arrival time and problems with luggage this was the last thing we needed. There were 7 people in the lift and when we got out we were told that there were too mabny people in their there should be only 4 - which was supririsng as there was no sign to this affect. The frondt desk behaved like this was a noraml occurance. All trips in the lift were fine and there were more than 4 people in thereWhen we checked in they only had it down for 2 people although I booked for 3. We got a extra bed and towels quite promptly There was the continental breakfast + coffee in the lobby which was good. The linen was clean We also got a car called for us on our last day which was nice.All in all not a bad experience. The area was so quiet I think I would have prefered to stay in times square or on the upper west side where I have stayed previously.I wander those who say it was noisy what days they were staying. Maybe as it was Xmas weekend but the area looked like a residential area - as if it was the outskirts of the busy areas - Times Square, Macey's etcThe staff were pleasant I would say that is worth staying again

Jan 13 2005	A great base for a very happy week	We booked The Marcel through last minute .com as part of a flight and hotel package recognising it would be cheap and cheerful. The 1st room we were given after checking in was on the 2nd floor, we took one look at it and point blank refused to stay in it (Think the hotel room Tom Hanks stayed in the movie 'Big'!) The guy on reception was very accomodating and moved us immediately to a room on the 6th floor, which whilst being relatively small was perfectly formed with a great view of the Empire State Building. All room amenities functioned perfectly, the bed was exceedingly comfortable, and the Bathroom was fine.Location-wise the hotel is in a good area, with most attractions being walking distance, Greenwich, Union Square etc... are also accessible by foot, and the subway is nearby for those attractions further afield. Surrounding areas are good for food and bars, the nearby Hairy Monk Irish bar has to get a special mention for friendly staff and a decent pint!We had a great week in NY and couldn't really find much at fault with the Marcel

Jan 12 2005	Bad times at the Marcel	I made reservations by phone and internet for two separate occasions and both times my reservations were "invalid" when I arrived at the hotel. Both times, the desk manager did little in the way of helping us locate another hotel, claiming the mixup was unavoidable. The second time it happened, they sent us to a hotel that required a 20 minute cab ride, the cost of which did in no way make up for the "good deal" they supposedly gave us. The two times I did stay at the Marcel with no reservation problems, the person handing out beverages in the breakfast "dining" room, arbitrarily decided who could get more than one beverage at a time. Don't say you weren't warned!

Jan 10 2005	Positive review good bargain hotel for NYC	I read the other reviews posted here and wanted to share my positive experience. This is a budget hotel, the rooms are smaller than average but clean and the bed was very comfortable. Duvet covers on the bed were clean (white!) and the sheets and towels smelled fresh and were also clean and white. The staff was courteous and helpful and even called a town car for us on our day of departure. They gladly let us store our bags for the remainder of our last day there without a problem.Two things were a problem, the heat in the room was impossible to regulate. We slept with the window open (in January), and the elevator could use some work. It was very slow.Sightseers, shopping spree-ers and generaly anyone looking for a hotel to just sleep and shower in would do good here. Business travelers would do well elsewhere as the rooms are not business friendly. I did not hear any noises from any bars or restaurants nearby as other reviews stated, even with the wondow open the whole stay. I inquired at the front desk about a bar and they did not have one so perhaps the motel is on an upswing, or perhaps I just picked a good weekend to stay, but I felt comfortable.

Dec 23 2004	Don't Do It!	My best girlfriend and I stayed there for 3 nights. It was the most horrible hotel room we had every seen. We were expecting a trendy comfortable room near all the attractions, and what we were left with were bags under our eyes. The room was constantly dark, we actually had to take the lamp shades off to see what we were wearing. Open the window shade you say? It looked right into another couples' room. The bed was creaky and uncomfortable, and in the morning, our saving grace was the luxury breakfast of warm orange juice and stale bagels. It is close to alot of attractions, but just not worth the hassle of an uncomfortable bed and smelly, dark rooms. If you don't expect much from the service (they took 2 hours to bring us additional towels), and a not so clean atmosphere, come to this hotel.

Dec 22 2004	Don't stay here if you need to sleep!	I have stayed at the Marcel several times over the years since it was refurbished. When I first stayed there it was a relatively quiet (given the location) and undiscovered hotel offering good rates. The upper floors had just been refurbished and although some of the rooms are small they were all furnished to a high standard, with good bathrooms. Since then however I have noticed a marked decline in standards, to the extent that I will no longer stay there. The main problem is the bar and nightclub that operates on the ground floor and basement of the hotel. On Thursday, Friday and Saturday nights it's impossible to sleep because of the constant thump thump of the music. One night I stayed there the music continued until 3am, and I had to get up at 5am to catch a flight home. On subsequent stays I requested a room on higher floors but even then there's the noise made by clubbers leaving the hotel in the early hours, the taxis and cars that pick them up, and accompanying shrieking and shouting. I've also noticed that the hotel, which was originally marketed as an upmarket business hotel, is now favoured by teenagers and as a result there was a lot of nocturnal thumping, banging doors and running about. On my last stay I ended up going to stay with some friends nearby just to get a decent night's sleep! This is for me the main issue with the hotel, that the hotel management are trying to run a nightclub at the same time as presenting the hotel as a superior destination for business travellers, which it isn't. There's also the problem that there's only one v-e-r-y slow lift, so you can end up waiting up to ten minutes just to leave the hotel; the staff are friendly enough by New York standards but things often seem disorganised, and the bar doubles as the breakfast room so looks pretty shabby and worse for wear the mornings after the nights before.My recommendation would be: great if you're under 20 and not looking to sleep, but if you are older and want a decent night's sleep, stay elsewhere.

Nov 23 2004	Don't stay at the Marcel	Stayed at the Marcel for 1 night a month ago. Was quite happy to check out the following morning. And even happier that I had followed the gut feeling I had got from other TripAdvisor users and cancelled the other 6 nights I had booked at first. The room we got was small and very dark - window facing a brick wall - and the 'design' was nowhere to be found. Can't complain on the service as we really didn't get any. All in all, you can do a lot better in NYC - even in the same area as the Marcel. I can truly recommend the Park South Hotel - very nice rooms, great breakfast, excellent service and location (close to the no 6 subway line).

Nov 18 2004	Great Weekend	Getting a hotel for the marathon weekend was always going to be difficult and after reading the reviews I was worried about staying at The Marcel however the accommodation was fine for what we required. We were hardly in the place, who wants to lounge around a hotel when you have the City to explore; coffee and breakfast were provided but why use it when you can have a mountain of food and re-fills in the dinners close by? At least you had the option.....The staff were friendly and helpful when getting cabs and with luggage. No problems with the water temperature. Rooms were on the small side but for the location what do you expect?This hotel isn't the best in Manhattan but for a short break and at a reasonable price compared to the other hotels for that weekend, I'd go back.

Oct 27 2004	not bad but there are better values available	My wife and I recently stayed at the Marcel for four nights. I had read other reviews here, both good and bad, and remained optimistic for our stay. Too bad, we should have rebooked our stay at another property.On our first day we arrived early and the hotel stowed our bags until check-in. When we returned we were checked into room 312. Our room was very small (15 feet by 15 feet) and had a queen bed with one small closet, a small bathroom, and one window. We immediately noticed the room was hot, stuffy, and dry. The room had a hvac unit under the window, and we turned on the AC. The AC unit got cold but it's fan did not blow air into the room. Even with the window open it was impossible to get a draft going. When we called the front desk they were unsympathetic and said there was nothing they could do. Eventually the room cooled off, but it was still stuffy and dry. We woke up every morning with dry sinuses and throats.The room was clean, but in need of repairs. There were some gashes in the wallpaper and the roman shade was frayed on the edges and difficult to operate. The lighting in the room was dim, and there was no workspace area. The bed was comfortable, the sheets and towels clean, and the bathroom's water pressure was good and the water temperature was hot. There is plenty of audible street noise in the room, but it's New York, what do you expect?We tried the coffee machine in the lobby and it was awful. It is not maintained regularly and operates poorly. There is a Starbuck's one block away and well worth the walk. The hotel's breakfast of bagels and juice are average. They also provide copies of the Financial Times each morning in the lobby.Overall, this hotel should be two stars. It is trying to be a boutique hotel when it is clearly a budget hotel and an overpriced one at that. Any photos on the internet have clearly undergone some photoshop magic. My guess is that some rooms fair better than others, if you are willing to take that chance. We did not complain too much because it was a business trip and the room was prepaid. However, we would not stay here again as there are much better properties to stay at in the same price range or less (Habitat NYC, On The Ave, and the Roger Williams to name a few).

Oct 20 2004	Great value!	We stayed at the Marcel for eight days and had a very good experience. Yes, things are getting worn and frayed in this always booked, heavily travelled hotel (and whoever laid the carpet/hung the wallpaper was inept) but overall everything was just fine and most importantly CLEAN. Please keep in mind that this is a budget hotel, not the Soho Grand. For the price, it offers a lot more value than other hotels I've stayed at in the area. The employees were extremely helpful and prompt, the view out our 7th floor windows was great, and the bed was so comfortable it was hard to get out of it in the morning. We will stay here again.

Oct 13 2004	Until day 7 it was good!!	Our stay was generally satisfactory until day7 when $770 worth of cash and travellers cheques had been taken from our room!!!! This hotel had no safety deposit boxes or room safes which i find incredible for a hotel in a chain of 4 in 2004!!! Horay to the person that went into our room as they obviously needed it more than i did, "you live and learn" as they say but we went on to have the most enjoyable day of our hols despite this incident (the new york police dept is certainly an experience) So would i advise this hotel....... NO trust is not too much to ask. A reputation should be built upon this, although this hotel has a good location i cannot advise anyone to stay here!

Oct 12 2004	Marcel great for us!	The one thing I can tell from these reviews is that the Marcel must be very inconsistant. However, for my family (3 rooms for 2 nights), it was great! The staff were helpful and nice and the accommodations were pleasant. To be honest, the rooms didn't seem exceptionally small to me for a NYC hotel in this price range. I can say that rooms 407, 803, and 804 were very nice. The air conditioning (something some reviews complained about) was just fine. So, perhaps you can request one of these rooms and be satisfied.

Oct 10 2004	Great Hotel	september 23th till october the 3th of 2004 was our 10 days in The Marcel hotel.We had from the day that we arrived, till the day we left, a very good experience in that hotel.We knew that the rooms where small and with 3 adults it was a bit small but we could managed, you can't expect much for the money we paid for the rooms....When we arrived some one directly came to help us out of our taxi, at the desk we got a nice reception from the staff and we got without problem our cards(keys) to go upstairs.As we enter the room, put the light on and we saw a (small) room with 2 double beds and a tv and a gameconsole for the kids( you have to pay for these games and films) for 3 adults it's enough space but when you use that room for 4 adults it's way too small then, but good for 3 people (adults) that's for sure.The room are cleaned every day and the service to guest is superb...nice and friendly staff.The hall downstairs is in the morning a breakfast hall where you can toast your bagels with cream cheese and jam and get fresh coffee and orangejuice every morning.There is also a expresso machine where you can get as much coffee as you can drink in many ways.But you must now how to handle the machine, sometimes the coffeebeans won't go down( so do as the man who serves breakfast in the morning,make sure that you losing up the beans with the plastic knife in the coffee container on top of the machine....LOL) as the machine grinds it's own coffee makes it in expresso or capuchino or what ever you want to make......Everything went well with our stay, but of course there where some customers, who did not get what they bargained for(budget hotel!)...but this hotel has 97 room and sometimes it can go wrong....but in our case everything went smooth and pleasant....Only a tip for those who stay there with 3 adults make sure you get enough towels and toilet paper!!!!!This hotel can't go wrong for the money I paid for and the area it was in!!!!!!!!!!Great area to eat and drink!

Oct 3 2004	Beware!!	I have been to New York many times and this was by far the absolute worse hotel I had ever stayed in. If they knew I was staying an entire week (7 days) why did they put me in a room where nothing worked. I will NEVER stay here again and I suggest none else does either.

Sep 21 2004	Good experience for a long weekend.	My sister and I stayed for a 3 day weekend. We loved the location of Marcel. The staff was very friendly and accomodating on every level. The bagels and juice were quite good too. The only complaint we would have is the lack of hot water. It was hard to turn the knob far enough to make it hot. And the hot water knob on the sink kept popping off. The walls are thin but it's New York City. You are going to hear noise 24/7. The beds were very comfortable.

Sep 13 2004	Underwhelming	This place trys to be a hip, unique boutique NYC hotel, but it's pretty rough around the edges...i.e. not that clean and a bit tattered. The decor reminded me of Ikea-cheap. The service was indifferent, not even a smile when you walk in the entrance. And don't expect anything beyond "no frills" ameneties. The room was what I called "The Cave". It was TINY and the only window was down this small hallway that served no purpose and faced another hotel room window in the back of the hotel which meant a depressing, dark and dreary room, not to mention the fear that your neighbor could be looking into the room if your shade was up. My husband arrived a few days before I did and had I been the first to arrive I would have asked for a different room considering he was staying for 9 nights, but he was tired and isn't as picky as I am. The bathroom was nice and clean but your arm hit the toliet paper dispenser everytime you sat on the loo because it was such a small bathroom. We had the A/C on HIGH the entire time just to keep the temp comfortable, even though it was not that hot outside. The location of the hotel is fine and pretty centrally located. But, for the same range price, you can find better places in New York.

Sep 10 2004	Good experience	The Marcel was a nice, clean hotel with funky decor. Our room was nice and the bed was really comfortable. The air conditioning seemed a bit noisy at first but you get used to it and at least it drowns out the noise of Third Ave. The only problem we encountered was the lack of hot water in the hotel. We were there for a week and, for two of those days, we had no hot water (nor did the rest of the hotel). The reception staff weren't very sympathetic and kept saying the problem would be fixed 'in an hour' which was a complete lie. It was really hot in NY and it wasn't pleasant to have to spend a day sightseeing and then go on a long-haul flight without having had a shower...

Aug 30 2004	Don't expect to much and it'll be great	When we arrived, we needed to present a credit card. We don't have one, so we had to pay a $200 warrant. It was refunded without any problem after a friend helped us out.We had no problems with the staff, the AC worked fine and the rooms were very clean. The toilet didn't flush properly. TV had about 20 channels, including NBC, CBS, FOX, ABC,... and a Nintendo, but I guess you'll have to pay for that. You can also order a recent movie at your TV. Nice shower, low bath, very nice bed. We had a lot of noise from 3rd Avenue but hey, this is NYC. It didn't bother us.If your looking for a nice place to rest your head: this is it. Don't stay here if you're looking for much more.

Aug 17 2004	Terrible experience	We had a voucher for 3 persons (2 adults, 1 child). When we arrived they were quite surprised to see The room they offered us had one bed! They said that they'll put in a bed for the child, but there was no space in the room for that bed. We didn't accept it and got offered a room with two beds. The room was located towards the backyard and was dark because the window was covered. Outside the window there was a pump noising 24hrs. The electronic keys never worked. At least not for our room but - as we were told - for the room next to ours. The included breakfast was ok and the italian coffee machine was marvelous.

Aug 9 2004	Horrible experience!!!	I went to NYC for a long weekend escape (4 days) and slept in a different bed the 3 nights we stayed at The Marcel. They came, they saw, they didn't fix and we were given an "upgrade" to another room, which was even worst than the one before. Aug 9 2004	Excellent	I was kind of nervous to see what the hotel was like since this was the first time that I had been to NY, but this hotel was excellent. They offer a free continental breakfast which is hard to come by in New York, and it is close to the 6 train. The only problem that I had was the water pressure sucked and the staff could have been happier, but other than that i would stay there again.

Jul 26 2004	Terrible experience	We came to NY with a friend at about 9 pm. I had a reservation for 1 double room with 2 double beds. Luckily, I had a printout confirming our prepaid reservation. I showed him the printout, and he told me that he did not care too much, and that they did not have any rooms left. Be ware of hotels Bentley and The Marcel!

Jul 22 2004	Would stay for business not for pleasure	The hotel looks far nicer and considerably more spacious when looking on Expedia. The front desk was friendly and helpful; unfortunately, the hotel furnishings (rooms and lobby included) remind me of worn IKEA furniture, which while modern, doesn't necessary make me want to stay there again. Jun 28 2004	Efficient clean cheap and quiet with a comfortable bed.	We had room 511. EXCELLENT room for a couple. Quiet, clean, efficient. Don't expect to be waited on hand & foot, but do expect quick check-in and check-out, as well as courteous staff. Bed was so comfortable, we over slept. Room is small, but well designed use of space. No ESPN, though. Definitely going back.

Apr 12 2004	Good for the price	We stayed at the Marcel for a week in April, and had been a little apprehensive before arriving because of some of the reviews on this site. So how does it compare with what contributors have said? It is true that the hotel could do with some remodelling - it looks like it underwent a makeover a few years back and hasn't been touched since. However, if this happened, I'm sure the room prices would rocket. What you do get is an adequate-sized room (in our case with a pleasingly large and comfortable bed), a great location (very handy for midtown and downtown and with good subway links), a complimentary breakfast (with unlimited tasty bagels), as well as efficient and friendly staff. If you want all this on a moderate budget, then go for it. You will find far worse in Manhattan at a similar price!

Apr 2 2004	Good but it just needs a little bit more	We stayed at the Marcel for 4 nights. First the good: The staff was very pleasant. Being greeted by a doorman, the lobby cappuccino machine and wonderful continental breakfast were very nice touches. I really liked the decor as well, it was simple & stylish. Yes the rooms in Manhattan are small. At the Marcel, I saw a single bed room and I was very glad we weren't staying in one. The double bed room we had was a good size for the city. The showers had fabulous hot water all of the time. The hotel location was wonderful. Friendly pubs, groceries, & diners right there on the block, a Walgreen's down the street & very convenient to the #6 train, and the bus stop right outside on the corner. The hotel really has the potential of being great, it just needs a little more attention to detail, once you leave the lobby area it loses its glimmer. There is only one (slow) elevator for the entire building, and the staircases are used primarily by the maid staff -- I ended up in the service area when I tried to take them down. The AC didn' t work at all in our room so we had to open the window which looked out to a brick wall and roof below. There was no screen on the window, and we were nervous about the many visible pigeons making there way into our room if we kept the window open to high. Unlucky for us that our neighbors above woke us up at 4:30 a.m. each morning, and the shower pipes seemed to rattle up there. I would stay here again, but for the price, I would really like to see some improvements with the quality of the facilities.

Mar 31 2004	Needs an Excellent Managment Staff to bring it to life!	Small and centrally located, this hotel could use some work. I was completely ready for small rooms since I had travelled to NYC before and knew small rooms were normal. Since it was concidered to be a "boutique" hotel, i thougt it would pay more attention to detail, however, the airconditioner wouldn't perform as any normal unit would. The desk staff were very friendly and accomodating. The music in the lobby was more than loud enough to start a party. The cappucino maker in the lobby was a very nice touch with continental breakfast as complimentary. The used gilchrist and soames bath products which raises them to a boutique level hotel, but over all it had a feeling that seemed musty, a bit dirty and in definite need of an excellent management staff that could easily make this a little gem of a hotel to stay. A note about me, I'm a guy and a bed, bathroom, and airconditioner is what I normally require however when one of those items isn't running properly, I tend to get bent out of shape. I'm simple and when going to a boutique hotel isn't a simple and easy fix, this seasoned traveller tells others. The end result? Would I stay here again??? Yes, if the damn AC is working properly and the locks would give a proper sense of security. I hope you enjoy your travels wherever you go.

Mar 28 2004	Great value for your money!	I stayed in the Marcel last weekend for a quick trip to NYC. This is a great place to stay if you're looking for a place to sleep on a tight budget. The bed was large, very comfortable, and looked exactly like it does in the pictures on the hotel's website. What the picture does not convey so well is how small the room is. However, its New York and if you want what would be an average sized room anywhere else, expect to pay for it. The bathroom was very nice with marble and a pedastal sink. We had a view of the Empire State Building which was unexpected, but nice. I have also stayed in the Ameritania and prefer the Marcel because it was better lit and not so dingy looking as the Ameritania. There is only 1 elevator and it is slow and small. Do not stay in the Marcel if you are a heavy packer and have loads of luggage as there is very little space to store them in the regular rooms. I have no idea how much space is availabe in their studios. However, if you'll only be in the city for a short while, the Marcel would be a great place, especially if you want to save your money for more fun activities in the city!

Mar 15 2004	Good Budget Hotel	I stayed at the Marcel Hotel last week with a few apprehensions after reading the reviews on this site about the lack of heat. But, my friend recommended this hotel to me, saying that it was a decent place despite the very small rooms, so I decided to give it a shot.The sleeping rooms are definitely small, but if all you need is a place to lay your head at night, it'll do. The bathroom was pretty nice with marble floors and tiles and a pedestal sink. I love pedestal sinks, but there wasn't much space to put my toiletries down.The decor of the hotel and the rooms is minimalist chic and reminds me of IKEA furniture. I liked the furniture decor in the lobby and the lounge.A nice feature is that the Marcel offers free bagels, orange juice and coffee in the morning...not too many places offer complimentary food anymore!My biggest complaint is that my room was way too hot for me! (opposite from other reviews I've read here) It was an oven when I walked in and I had to turn on the cooler which helped me that evening, but when I woke up the next morning, the cool air turned into hot air and I was sweating and roasting again! I called to complain and ask about the heating/air controls and they told me it was central heating and could not be controlled in individual rooms, so they sent an engineer up to help me open my window which helped immensely!The down side was that my room faced E. 24th St. so since I had to sleep with the window open so I wouldn't sweat to death, I ended up not sleeping well due to the noise from the street below.The walls are thin, the hallsway are narrow, and the elevator is tiny, but it's still a decent hotel for the price you're paying.I liked the area because it was less touristy and more residential (it's near a college) and it was a nice walk to Greenwich Village and Soho.The price I got for this hotel was $109, but I think it could be a little less for what you get...like $89-99.But, since it's New York City, $109 is probably still a good deal.

Feb 20 2004	We thought it was great	We were also a bit worried, having read a bad review just before we left England. However, we were very pleasantly surprised. The hotel staff were all very helpful and friendly. The room was extremely clean and very warm. The breakfast included in the price was an added bonus as we thought the price was only for the room. Coffee was available at all times and free of charge in the downstairs foyer. We would certainly recommend the hotel.

Feb 17 2004	Pleasantly Surprised!	I was very weary about going to this hotel after reading some shocking reviews, but I am happy to report that our stay at the Marcel was very comfortable. Fair enough, the room was small but like prevoisly said, space is hard to come by in NY. The bed was extremely comfortable, the bathroom was spotless and the room was cleaned every day. Heater/AC was in excellent working order though our latch was a bit suspect, but you always have another lock. The elevator was in prefect condition and breakfast was always waiting for you coming down at 7am. The doorman always opened doors for us and even arranged to store our baggage after we checked out so we could finish off some sightseeing, he even arranged a car to take us to the airport. All the staff greeted you with a smile and were pleasant. All in all I would definetly recommed the Marcel for anyone on a tight budget or who are just looking for a place to rest their weary feet. WELL DONE MARCEL! You made our trip complete.

Jan 23 2004	Shocking - Never again!!!!!	This hotel is a disgrace. I stayed for three nights in December 2003.
